thread.title: Fossils show big bug ruled the seas 460 million years ago
thread.title_full: Fossils show big bug ruled the seas 460 million years ago

title: Fossils show big bug ruled the seas 460 million years ago
text: Fossils show big bug ruled the seas 460 million years ago By Associated Press | August 31, 2015 @ 6:00 pm \n This rendering provided by Yale University shows a Pentecopterus decorahensis. Earthâs first big predatory monster was a weird water bug, newly found fossils show. Almost half a billion years ago, Earthâs dominant large predator was a sea scorpion that grew to 5 feet 7 inches with a dozen claw arms sprouting from its head and a spike tail, according to a new study. (Patrick J. Lynch/Yale University via AP)\n
